resources.string: The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE, read I-Triple-E) is a professional association headquartered in New York City that is dedicated to advancing technological innovation and excellence. It has about 425,000 members in about 160 countries, slightly less than half of whom reside in the United States. IEEE is the world\’s largest professional association dedicated to advancing technological innovation and excellence for the benefit of humanity. IEEE and its members inspire a global community through its highly cited publications, conferences, technology standards, and professional and educational activities. IEEE\'s membership has long been composed of engineers, scientists, and allied professionals. These include computer scientists, software developers, information technology professionals, physicists, medical doctors, and many others. It is an association designed to serve professionals involved in all aspects of the electrical, electronic and computing fields and related areas of science and technology that underlie modern civilization.

IEEE has:

 • More than 425,000 members in more than 160 countries, more than 50 percent of whom are from outside the United States
 • More than 116,000 Student members
 • 333 Sections in 10 geographic regions worldwide
 • 2,195 Chapters that unite local members with similar technical interests
 • 2,354 student branches at colleges and universities
 • 800 student branch chapters of IEEE technical societies

At the pre-college level, the IEEE works with industry, universities and government to raise students\’ literacy in science, maths, engineering and technology. IEEE journals are consistently among the most highly cited in electrical and electronics engineering, telecommunications and other technical fields. IEEE is a leading developer of international standards that underpin many of today\'s telecommunications, information technology and power generation products and services. IEEE also produces technical books, monographs, guides and textbooks.

It was the onset of the year 2009. IEEE, USA was celebrating its 125th anniversary. Thousands of miles away, a new student branch was being formed with a mere strength of around 30 members. Without any guidance or previous experience, the Branch Counselor and her ExeCom were struggling hard to give this student branch an orientation and structure. After one year, the student branch was termed as the fastest upcoming branches in the entire Delhi Section, while the branch counselor received the rare honour of \“Best Branch Counselor of an Upcoming Branch\” at the Annual General Meeting of IEEE, Delhi Section. Yes, the branch is none other than our own college, i.e. Maharaja Surajmal Institute Of Technology.

The student branch of MSIT was registered with IEEE, USA in March, 2009 and it marked the beginning of the journey of IEEE, MSIT onto the path of constant upgradations and developments. The reins of this newly formed branch were given in the capable hands of Ms. Suman Mann, Reader, IT Department and she assumed the responsibility of Branch Counselor, IEEE, MSIT.

Many seminars and workshops were organized by the IEEE Student Branch in its endeavor. These included a workshop by Mr. Ankit Mittal on Basic Robotics and Autonomous Robots, which was held in collaboration with IEEE, Delhi Section. Similarly, a 2-day workshop on Wireless/Autonomous Robotics, I-MANIA, was organized at the campus in collaboration with OSUM-MSIT. Both the events were a huge success. By the year end, an IEEE awareness seminar was held with guest speakers from IEEE, DTU (formerly DCE). It helped create awareness among the students about the benefits of joining IEEE and helped in the rise in number of memberships in the present academic year.
IEEE-MSIT is gradually becoming a name which engineers of various institutes have started to recognize. As Robert Frost once said… \“Miles to go before I sleep, Miles to go before I sleep.\”
Ms. Savita Ahlawat\n\nChapter Advisor, IEEE CS MSIT
Mr. Parveen Kumar\n\nChapter Advisor, IEEE MTT-S MSIT
Ms. Jyoti Jain\n\nChapter Advisor, IEEE PES MSIT

The scope of the Society shall encompass all aspects of theory, design, practice, and application relating to computer and information processing science and technology.

The IEEE Computer Society is the world\'s leading membership organization dedicated to computer science and technology. Serving more than 60,000 members, the IEEE Computer Society is the trusted information, networking, and career-development source for a global community of technology leaders that includes researchers, educators, software engineers, IT professionals, employers, and students.

The IEEE Computer Society sponsors more than 200 technical conferences and events each year, including the industry-oriented "Rock Stars" series, all over the world, aimed at research and industry professionals. Our publications are peer-reviewed, indexed, and authored by technology thought leaders worldwide, and include 17 scholarly journals and 13 magazines featuring the latest technology trends. We also offer cutting-edge products such as the myComputer app (available for iOS or Android), that provide unprecedented user-driven access to our content, and our Digital Library with more than 550,000 articles and papers spanning the full spectrum of computer science and technology.

In addition to conferences and publishing, the IEEE Computer Society is a leader in professional education and training, and has forged development and provider partnerships with major institutions and corporations internationally. These rich, self-selected, and self-paced programs help companies improve the quality of their technical staff and attract top talent while reducing costs.

We\'re on the cutting edge of current issues in technology, and we have a wide range of networking and volunteer leadership opportunities for our members, including over 400 local and regional chapters as well as more than 40 technical communities. We recognize our field\'s pioneers and visionaries through a robust awards program and work to support the next generation of technology leaders through our student scholarships.

The IEEE Computer Society is a volunteer-led organization with an active and engaged membership driving excellence at the governance level—President, Vice Presidents, and executive officers; the Board of Governors, operational Boards (such as Publications, Technical & Conference Activities, and Professional and Educational Activities), and a variety of permanent and ad hoc committees. Our publications are led by volunteer Editors-in-Chief and editorial boards. All these activities are supported by a professional staff, led by an Executive Director, with offices in Washington, DC and Southern California.  IEEE offices in Tokyo, China, India and Singapore also lend support for Society activities. 

The IEEE Computer Society is the community for technology leaders. As the computing professional\'s single, unmatched source for technology information, inspiration and collaboration, we are the organization that computing\'s leaders, innovators, and researchers trust. .

Computer Society Vision

To be the leading provider of technical information, community services, and personalized services to the world\'s computing professionals.

Computer Society Goal

Be essential to the global technical community and computer professionals everywhere and be universally recognized for the contributions of technical professionals in developing and applying technology to improve global conditions.

IEEE MSIT CS Student branch is an initiative to bring exposure to the members about the advancements in the field of Computer Science Technology, to build confidence, increase their interaction abilities and to make contacts with the experts of various technical fields.The student branch of MSIT was registered with IEEE, USA in March, 2009 and it marked the beginning of the journey of IEEE, MSIT onto the path of constant upgradations and developments. In the year of 2013, IEEE MSIT CS came into existence and since then it has never looked back.

Following are the benefits of joining IEEE CS MSIT:-

Computer Magazine

The flagship publication of the IEEE Computer Society.

Conference Events

Forums for top minds to come together to develop, validate, and disseminate leading-edge information.

Webinars

Cost-effective, cutting-edge training — anytime, anywhere.

ComputingEdge

A curated digest with articles from our 13 leading technology publications plus original content in a single experience.

Chapter Membership

More than 480 worldwide chapters offer leadership, professional development, and career advancement opportunities for both professionals and students.

myCS

Member-only, interactive, mobile-ready digital publication portal.

Code Start (31st October 2015)

IEEE Computer Society through its endeavors has always been instrumental in conducting popular coding competitions round the year which are eagerly awaited by the whole student comrade.

Following the trend, IEEE Computer Society, organized Codestart - The competitive programming competition on 31st October this year. The event was organized in MSIT labs.

Around 32 teams, i.e. 100 students from various streams and years participated in the competition to showcase their skills and to prove their mettle on ground zero. The winning team was awarded certificates and cash prizes.

Machine Learning (29th January 2016)

The computer society has been crucial in popularizing some of the latest market trends for fresher advancements. Thus, the event not only polished the technical skill set of the students but also provided them with plethora of opportunities.

Introduction to Machine Learning on 29th January 2016(Friday)

The session was taken by Mr. Karan Hora, final year student of CSE department, MSIT. It was attended by about 50 students from different streams and branches.

The session gave an introduction to machine learning to the students, including supervised learning, CART model, random forest, neural networks, etc, deep learning, reinforcement learning, real time twitter sentiment mining, etc. Students were shown examples of recommendation system used in YouTube. Also, a live example of different Self Taught Game Playing AI was demonstrated by the trainer. Students showed great interest in the topic and session ended with success.

Summer Mentored Projects (15th June 2016 – 31st July 2016)

IEEE MSIT Computer Society Student Branch organised a project mentorship program for all Computer Society members. Siddarth Goyal, Mayank Kashyap and Devika Mehra were assigned as the mentors for guiding students to develop basic understanding of Python, Ruby on Rails and Android Development. It was attended by 8 students of the Computer Society.

The Python session enlightened the students to learn the necessary skills one needs to start developing websites using python. Under the mentorship, http://www.freahers.xyz and https://bhavya-blogs.appspot.com were the successful end products developed by the students. The website was not only based on the concepts of python but also included the knowledge of Google App Engine, Jinja2, CSS and javascript. It was an encouraging and enriching experience for students.

The session on Ruby on Rails was a reinforcing session for the fresher. The students were groomed to develop web applications using Ruby. They were given the privilege to work on IEEE website. The work was done on both backend and frontend. The students were taught how to make developing web application easier and fun to code. The session will not only help students develop websites but also assisted them to step in the field of Open Source Development.

The session on Android App Development was an advantageous program for all the students involved. It assisted students to develop an insight in the field of Mobile Development. The session started with the basic knowledge of Java and XML. Students were then lead to the basic development of Android with all its layout, views and listeners. The students were aided to maintain their data on the server. The students felt encouraged to learn a new skill and were inspired to put it to some great use. Student showed a great interest during the session and made the mentorship a great success.

Boot Camp (13th August 2016)

A boot - camp was organized in association with Coding Ninjas by IEEE MSIT Computer Society on 13th August 2016. The theme of the boot - camp was to help the students “Kick - start with their programming career.”

The primary speaker was Ankush Singla, an alumni of Stanford University and IIT – Delhi. He has an experience of working at bigwigs like Amazon and Facebook. He is a code enthusiast and has gained a lot of expertise in this field. The event started with a warm welcome to the dignitary by our respected Deputy Director, Prof. Poonam Bansal. The event was attended by enthusiastic freshers and some students of second and third year. The attendees varied over the all branches.

Initially, Mr. Singla helped the students to develop the skills required by a programmer. Starting from the very basic to the intermediate level of coding, students learned a lot. Most of the students carried their laptops with them. The basic programs were not only discussed, but also implemented by the students using an IDE.

All the attendees thoroughly enjoyed the session. Mr. Singla also encouraged the students to enhance their programming to the fullest. He broadens the horizon for all the students by making them aware of the plausible field, they should be working on so as to utilize their capabilities to the fullest. The various options highlighted by him were Competitive programming, Mobile development, Web Development and Open Source Development.

The event was a great success. It provided the students with the much needed skill and encouragement to start their programming career. The knowledge gained by them would help them explore the various domains.

• Codestart Extended
  • Semester Mentored Program
  • Coding Test Compitition
•  Mr. Aakash Bansal received IEEE Computer Society Richard E. Merwin Student Scholarship 2016.

The IEEE Microwave Theory and Techniques Society (MTT-S) is a transnational society with more than 190 chapters worldwide. Our society promotes the advancement of microwave theory and its applications, including RF, microwave, millimeter-wave, and terahertz technologies.

For more than 60 years, the MTT-S has worked to advance the professional standing of its members and enhance the quality of life for all people through the development and application of microwave technology. As we enter into an exciting future, our mission is to continue to understand and influence microwave technology and to provide a forum for all microwave engineers. The MTT-S will continue to be the global focus for the promotion of the RF and microwave engineering profession, by advancing and distributing knowledge and supporting professional development.

This is an all-volunteer society, driven to excellence by its leadership and with the active participation of all its world-wide members.  The activities sponsored by the MTT-S include a broad spectrum of conferences, workshops, tutorials, technical committees, chapter meetings, publications and professional education programs. Our principal publications and conferences are world class, peer-reviewed and recognized as top of the class. Our professional venues provide a great opportunity for networking with experienced innovators, experts, and practitioners. Our volunteer programs provide for the development of critical, non-technical skills that enable you to be more effective professionally.

The core purpose of the Society is to foster the advancement and application of RF and microwave theory and techniques. Members of MTT-S are engaged in research, development, design, or manufacturing of high frequency materials, devices, circuits, components, or systems.

For more than 60 years the MTT-S has worked to advance the professional standing of its members and enhance the quality of life for all people through the development and application of microwave technology. As we enter into an exciting future, our mission is to continue to understand and influence microwave technology, and to provide a forum for all microwave engineers. The MTT-S will continue to be the global focus for promotion of the RF and microwave engineering profession, by advancing and distributing knowledge and supporting professional development. This is an all- volunteer society, driven to excellence by its leadership, with the active participation of all its world-wide members. The activities sponsored by the MTT-S include a broad spectrum of conferences, workshops, tutorials, technical committees, chapter meetings, publications and professional education programs. Our principal publications and conferences are world class, peer reviewed and recognized as top of class. Our professional venues provide a great opportunity for networking with experienced innovators, experts, and practitioners. Our volunteer programs provide for the development of critical, non-technical skills that enable you to be more effective professionally.

MTTS is a society aiming to foster the advancement and application of RF and microwave. The society commenced in MSIT to promote wireless technology in our institution with a target to research in the field of wireless technology.

IEEE MTT-S MSIT, has been solemn and successful in establishing its impression among fellow students by being righteous in accomplishing its aim to instill among students a view that would lead to development of critical technical skills that will enable them to be more effective professionally.

MTTS is a society aiming to foster the advancement and application of RF and microwave. The society commenced in MSIT to promote wireless technology in our institution with a target to research in the field of wireless technology.

IEEE MTT-S MSIT, has been solemn and successful in establishing its impression among fellow students by being righteous in accomplishing its aim to instill among students a view that would lead to development of critical technical skills that will enable them to be more effective professionally.

Summer Grants Program

Students are provided with the opportunity to work on different projects in the domain of RF and wireless communication. Following are the major projects that have been completed successfully,

1. Sudden Ionospheric Distrubances

2. NASA Radio Jove

3. Itty-Bitty Telescope

The similar sessions are being continued every year during the summer break for all the members of IEEE MTT-S MSIT.

• Mr. Anand Pratap Singh received IEEE MTT-S Undergraduate Scholarship 2016.
  • Mr. Aakash Bansal and Mr. Kshitij Tomar won IEEE MTT-S YouTube/YouKu Video Contest 2016.

The Power & Energy Society (PES) provides the world largest forum for sharing the latest in technological developments in the electric power industry, for developing standards that guide the development and construction of equipment and systems, and for educating members of the industry and the general public. Members of the Power& Energy Society are leaders in this field, and they — and their employers — derive substantial benefits from involvement with this unique and outstanding association.

The Mission of PES is:

To be the leading provider of scientific and engineering information on electric power and energy for the betterment of society, and the preferred professional development source for our members.

Field of Interest is:

The scope of the Society embraces research, development, planning, design, construction, maintenance, installation and operation of equipment, structures, materials and power systems for the safe, sustainable, economic and reliable conversion, generation, transmission, distribution, storage and usage of electric energy, including its measurement and control.

IEEE MSIT PES Student branch is an initiative to bring exposure to the members about the advancements in the field of power and energy technology, to build confidence, increase their interaction abilities and to make contacts with the experts of various technical fields.The student branch of MSIT was registered with IEEE, USA in March, 2009 and it marked the beginning of the journey of IEEE, MSIT onto the path of constant upgradations and developments. In the year of 2013, IEEE MSIT PES came into existence and since then it has never looked back. It is considered to be one of the most active PES societies in the Delhi section and has won two consecutive High Performance Chapter Awards for the year of 2014 and 2015. Recently, it also won the RES funding in the year of 2016.

Following are the benefits of joining IEEE PES MSIT:-

1. Notifications regarding all IEEE events happening across the globe.

2. Information regarding latest trends in the power and energy society.

3. Exclusive Access to PES resource center.

4. Free access to webinars and tutorials on the net.

5. Paper presentation opportunities and participation at various conferences.

6. Scholarship opportunities.

7. Networking opportunities with other PES members.

8. Access to all events organized by IEEE PES MSIT.

9. Can help to improve Resume and confidence to present yourselves.

10. Develop leadership qualities.

•  Industry lecture series by Mohak Tyagi, Gensol.

On 4th November,2015, IEEE MSIT PES organized a seminar as part of the Industrial lecture series. The topic of the seminar is “Solar Power Industry and its Prospects”. About 95 students from EEE 1st, 2nd 3rd year and IT 1st year attended this seminar. Solar power industry is one of the fastest growing industries,maintaing a annual growth of 40% annually. It is an area of utmost importance to meet requirements of growing economy and to promote the idea of sustainable development. The lecture had an overview of the present working system of solar energy in application, future growth trends, various trends in photovoltaics and thin film technologies and technical and managerial proceedings in an actual solar power project along with an interactive session with the guest speaker at the end of the event.

  •  October Project Week

On the occasion of the IEEE DAY, the POWER AND ENERGY SOCIETY (PES) of IEEE MSIT organized ‘OCTOBER PROJECT WEEK’ where a team of students had to register themselves and also had to submit their ideas for their projects. Each team were assigned a mentor, who guided them throughoutthe project work.

  •  Career Guidance Workshop

A workshop was organized by the electrical and electronics department and IEEE PES graciously hosted the seminar meeting on August 11, 2016.More than seventy students of EEE department actively participated in this workshop.The various topics to be studied during the four years of electrical and electronics engineering were briefed through presentations and interactive multiple choice questions. The former gold medalist also shared his experiences with the students and discussed about his future projects which included his project on smart grids

  •  Skill India Workshop

A workshop on " Skill INDIA" was organised by IEEE PES MSIT on 11th April, 2016. This workshop was organised to give information to students about the Skill India Movement and how to be part of it. This workshop also highlighted the various skills that a student must have in order to become a successful professional. This workshop was attended by 55 students and 10 guest members of the EEE departments of the Maharaja Surajmal Institute of Technology.

  • T.I.M.E Workshop

A workshop was organized by the electrical and electronics department in association with T.I.M.E. IEEE PES graciously hosted the seminar meeting on August 11, 2016.More than seventy students of EEE department actively participated in this workshop. The seminar was hosted by a former IIT gold medalist in electrical and electronics department and currently working with T.I.M.E. Triumphant Institute of Management Education Private Limited provides coaching classes for various entrance exams including GATE, CAT, Bank exams, CSAT. They informed about the various choices that an undergraduate electrical engineer can opt for.In the workshop, the students were schooled about advantages of becoming an electrical engineer. They were told about the elevated competition today which was roughly stated about 1.5 lakh and also about benefits offered after the introduction of 7 th  pay commission and its impact in the field of electrical engineering. The attendees were enlightened about different companies that offers job to an electrical engineer after securing a decent GATE score (Graduate aptitude test). Entrance exams such as Engineering Services Examination were discussed where students can apply.

  •  Summer Grant Program

IEEE PES MSIT Summer Project Initiative "Advancing humanity through technology" is the driving motive of IEEE. IEEE PES MSIT introduced the Summer Project Program, an initiative to impart practical electrical engineering skills to the students. The projects were fully sponsored. Each project was made by a group of students and the completed projects was displayed along with projects from IEEE MSIT project initiative at an exhibition later in college.

  •  Industrial trip to Kalinga Wires Pvt. Ltd.

On the 29th December 2016 the department of IEEE PES had organized an industrial visit for students of the MSIT EEE Branch who were accompanied by Mrs. Jyoti Jain of the EEE department. The visit was to the Kalinga Wires and Cables industries situated at Naraina Industrial area phase- I. Within the industry premises Mr. Ram Chandran serving as manger took charge and had taken the group to his cabin and briefed about how the cables and wires are major equipment for transmission & distribution of electrical power in substations, distribution systems, house wiring, street lighting. The company envisages manufacturing of PVC Insulated single/multicore wires and cables of 4mm 2  and 6mm 2   diameter copper conductors extensively used in house wiring service connections permanent & temporary connections of electrical power overhead lines .Their Plant produced flame resistant and retardant wire cables to adhere to the safety norms and restrict the fire and toxic smoke generation.

  •  Be-ENGG Workshops

The active members of IEEE PES MSIT, New Delhi organised a workshop in GD GOENKA PUBLIC SCHOOL, ROHINI on 5th October 2016. The workshop was well received and eqipped with interesting working models like LFRs, security system, etc. The basic aim to develop the interest of the young minds towards engineering. Topics like Semiconductors, and Power supplies were also explained. Origin and mission of IEEE were also discussed.

• Project Series
  • Lectures series
  • Be-Eng workshop
• Mayank Kataria was selected as a student delegate in the 2 nd PES student congress held at Kuala lumpur, Malayasia in August ,2016

•  Received HPSBC Award for the year of 2014 and 2015.
  •  Received RES funding.

IEEE Women in Engineering (WIE) is the largest international professional organization dedicated to promoting women engineers and scientists. We are a global network of women professionals dedicated towards advancements in the field of science and technology. The mission of IEEE WIE is to facilitate the recruitment and retention of women in technical disciplines globally. IEEE WIE envisions a vibrant community of IEEE women and men collectively using their diverse talents to innovate for the benefit of humanity.

 

IEEE WIE strives to:

  • recognize women\'s outstanding achievements in electrical and electronics engineering through IEEE Awards nominations;
  • organize receptions at major technical conferences to enhance networking and to promote membership in WIE;
  • advocate women in leadership roles in IEEE governance and career advancement for women in the profession;
  • provide assistance with the formation of new WIE Affinity Groups and support ongoing activities;
  • promote IEEE member grade advancement for women to the membership grades of Senior member and Fellow;
  • facilitate the development of programs and activities that promote the entry into and retention of women in engineering programs;
  • administer the IEEE Student-Teacher and Research Engineer/Scientist (STAR) Program to mentor young women in junior and high schools.

IEEE WIE MSIT is an affinity group under IEEE MSIT. We are a community of flourishing engineering students who wish to bolster the upcoming class of young female innovators and learners. IEEE MSIT has always dedicated itself to promote potential female researchers who still hesitate at the thresholds of laboratories. The mission of IEEE WIE is to inspire, engage, encourage, and empower IEEE women worldwide and to facilitate the recruitment and retention of women in technical disciplines globally. IEEE WIE envisions a vibrant community of IEEE women and men collectively using their diverse talents for innovating the world of tomorrow. Benefits of joining IEEE WIE members can meet colleagues with similar interests in promoting women in engineering and technology and participate in activities that support the WIE mission.

Following are the benefits of joining IEEE MSIT WIE:-

  • access to the electronic WIE Membership Directory;
  • monthly WIE electronic newsletter which contains career information, reports on WIE and Affinity Group activities, IEEE news, and more
  • opportunities to network, volunteer, and participate in local WIE activities.

<
  • Ms. Deepali Jain attended the International Leadership Summit 2016 at Pune
